snippet: François Hollande, who was the mayor of Tulle, France, for seven years, has won praise there for his common touch.
abstract: Francios Hollande completed his campaign for the French presidency in Tulle, France; Hollande, who served as mayor of Tulle for seven years, praised the city as a symbol of resistance during the World War II Nazi occupation. (M)6
lead_paragraph: TULLE, France -- François Hollande learned how to be a politician in this small city in the rural south-central region of France known as Corréze. Mr. Hollande chose to return to Tulle, where he served as mayor for seven years, for his last weekend of campaigning for the French presidency, to vote and to await the country's verdict on his candidacy. He delivered his victory speech on Sunday night on the Place de la Cathédrale, paying tribute to a region that ''gave me the most.''

headline.main: France's President-Elect Has Fans Aplenty at Home
